message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination suggest oral thrush, which is a fungal infection. Nystatin is an antifungal medication that would be the most appropriate pharmacotherapy. Triamcinolone is a steroid and would not be effective against a fungal infection. Acyclovir is used to treat viral infections, and Griseofulvin is used to treat fungal infections of the skin and nails, but not typically for oral thrush.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques and bleeding suggest oral thrush, which is caused by Candida albicans. Nystatin is an antifungal medication and the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for treating oral thrush. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid used to treat inflammation, acyclovir is an antiviral used to treat herpes infections, and griseofulvin is an antifungal medication used to treat skin and nail infections. These medications are not appropriate for treating oral thrush.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has signs of oral thrush, shown by the white plaques that bleed when scraped off. Nystatin is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for treating oral thrush. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid and may worsen the condition. Acyclovir is used for viral infections, and Griseofulvin is used for fungal infections of the skin, hair, and nails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques suggest oral candidiasis, which can be treated with Nystatin. Triamcinolone is a steroid and will not treat the underlying fungal infection. Acyclovir treats viral infections, and Griseofulvin treats fungal infections of the skin, hair, and nails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the visual examination suggest oral thrush, which is caused by an overgrowth of Candida. Nystatin is an antifungal medication that is commonly used to treat Candida infections. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid that is used to treat inflammation and asthma. Acyclovir is an antiviral medication that is used to treat herpes infections. Griseofulvin is an antifungal medication that is used to treat fungal infections of the skin and nails, but it is not effective against Candida infections in the mouth.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques on the tongue and buccal mucosa suggest oral thrush, which is a fungal infection. Nystatin is an antifungal medication commonly used to treat oral thrush. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid used for inflammation, but would not be effective against the fungal infection. Acyclovir is used for viral infections, and griseofulvin is used for fungal infections of the skin and nails, but not for oral thrush.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques that bleed when scraped off suggest oral candidiasis, and the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this is Nystatin. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation but will not treat the underlying infection. Acyclovir is used to treat viral infections and Griseofulvin is used to treat fungal infections of the skin, hair, and nails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. White plaques that bleed when scraped off suggest a fungal infection, most likely oral candidiasis. Nystatin is an antifungal medication commonly used for oral candidiasis. Triamcinolone is a steroid that may help with inflammation but is not the appropriate treatment for this condition. Acyclovir is an antiviral medication used to treat herpes infections, which is not likely the cause of the patient's symptoms. Griseofulvin is an antifungal medication used to treat skin and nail fungal infections, but is not typically used for oral candidiasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques that bleed when scraped off suggest oral thrush, which is caused by fungal overgrowth. Nystatin is an antifungal medication that is effective in treating oral thrush. Triamcinolone is a corticosteroid, which may exacerbate the fungal infection. Acyclovir is used to treat viral infections, and Griseofulvin is an antifungal medication used to treat skin infections such as ringworm.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The white plaques on the tongue and mucosa, as well as bleeding when scraped, suggest oral thrush caused by Candida albicans. Nystatin is an antifungal medication that can treat the infection. Triamcinolone, acyclovir, and griseofulvin are not effective against C. albicans.
